page.title: 20FINAL ASSESSMENT
page.content: General Observations: The area covered in this survey, we conclude, is most attractive in every way and satifies scientific, domestic, aesthetic and leisure interest. The great fear we have deduced during the survey, and which the Research team have pointed out in the field reports, is the danger of further industrial development, although this would of course satisfy the requirements of the local inhabitants of working age. The majority of the residents of the villages of Furness commute to work in Barrow and the suggestion that Askam could be self contained, from the point of view of employment, cannot be envisaged and allocation of land for industry does not necessarily mean that this advantage would be taken. The status quo may continue !
